multiscandllib.src package¶

Submodules¶

multiscandllib.src.custom_model module¶

multiscandllib.src.custom_model.custom_model_01(input_shape: Tuple[int, int, int], classes: int) → keras.models.Sequential¶

Create a custom model formed by 7 blocks.

Each block contains:

  • Conv2D

  • BatchNormalization

  • GaussianNoise

  • MaxPooling2D

After these blocks a classification block is added.

Args:

input_shape: The input shape (ex: (100, 100, 3))

classes: Number of classes

Returns:

model: The created model

multiscandllib.src.custom_model.custom_model_02(input_shape: Tuple[int, int, int]) → keras.models.Sequential¶

Create a custom model for binary classification formed by 3 blocks.

Each block contains:

  • Conv2D

  • MaxPooling2D

After these blocks a classification block is added.

Args:

input_shape: The input shape (ex: (100, 100, 3))

Returns:

model: The created model

multiscandllib.src.custom_model.get_model(input_shape: Tuple[int, int, int], classes: int) → keras.models.Sequential¶

multiscandllib.src.data_generator module¶

class multiscandllib.src.data_generator.DataGenerator(image_filenames: List[str], labels: List[int], batch_size: int, width_shift_range: float = 0)¶

Bases: keras.utils.Sequence

Class Data Generator for Keras.

multiscandllib.src.get_dataset module¶

multiscandllib.src.get_dataset.get_dataset(dataset_path: pathlib.Path, percent_train: int = 80, percent_val: int = 10, percent_test: int = 10, classes: List[str] = None) → Sequence[Tuple[List[str], List[int], List[str], List[int], List[str], List[int]]]¶

Gets filename and label lists of samples.

Args:

percent_train: (default 80)

percent_val: (default 10)

percent_test: (default 10)

Return:

training_ds: List of paths to the training dataset

training_labels: List of labels of the training examples

val_ds: List of paths to the validation dataset

val_labels: List of labels of the validation examples

test_ds: List of paths to the test dataset

test_labels: List of labels of the test examples

multiscandllib.src.get_dataset.get_files(dataset_path: pathlib.Path, classes: List[str], balanced: bool) → Tuple[List[pathlib.Path], List[List[int]]]¶

Get a list of files for our dataset.

Args:

dataset_path: A Path to the folder where the files are stored

classes: A list of the classes we want to include in our dataset

balanced: If balanced is set to True, then the number of examples for each class is balanced

Return:

A randomized list of paths to files with its corresponding labels in categorical format

multiscandllib.src.get_dataset.load_dataset(x_files: List[pathlib.Path]) → numpy.ndarray¶

Load the given dataset files in memory

Args:

x_files: List of paths to dataset

Return:

Numpy array containing the dataset

multiscandllib.src.get_dataset.serve_files(files: List[str], labels: List[int], quantity: int) → Tuple[List[pathlib.Path], List[List[int]]]¶

Serve example paths and labels using yield, from the given lists.

Args:

files: List of paths to examples

labels: List of labels (integer format)

quantity: Quantity to be served, if quantity is set to 0, yields remaining elements

Return:

Tuple of lists (files labels) containing the specified quantity

multiscandllib.src.plot_graphics module¶

multiscandllib.src.plot_graphics.plot_confusion_matrix(model, batch, labels, classes_names, prefix='', output_folder=None, save_figure=True, show_figure=True)¶

Plot confusion matrix.

Args:

model: Executed model

batch: Batch of the dataset to execute a validation step

labels: Labels of the batch

classes_names: Names of classes to show in the figure

prefix: Indicate a prefix to save the generated figure

output_folder: Folder where to save the generated figure

save_figure: If True the generated figure is saved to disk

show_figure: If True the figure is show in the screen

multiscandllib.src.plot_graphics.plot_performance_graphics(history, num_epochs, prefix='', output_folder=None, save_figure=True, show_figure=True)¶

Plot performance graphics of the training. Args:

history: History log after training a model

num_epochs: Number of epochs

prefix: Indicate a prefix to save the generated figure

output_folder: Folder where to save the generated figure

save_figure: If True the generated figure is saved to disk

show_figure: If True the figure is show in the screen

multiscandllib.src.read_arguments module¶

class multiscandllib.src.read_arguments.Argument¶

Bases: enum.Enum

Enum class to specify the possible fields in the arguments.

BATCH_SIZE = 3¶
CLASSES = 5¶
DATASET = 1¶
EPOCHS = 4¶
EXAMPLES = 6¶
LR = 7¶
OUTPUT = 2¶
PROG = 0¶
multiscandllib.src.read_arguments.read_arguments()¶

Read input arguments:

--dataset <path to the dataset>
--output <path to the output folder> #The folder is created if not exists
--batch_size <desired batch size, typically 32 or 64>
--epochs <num of epochs to perform>
--classes [Optional, list of classes] # default: folder names
--examples <num of examples to employ>
--lr <learning rate>
Return:

A dictionary with the arguments.
